text:
2. Associativity: ∀x,y,z ∈G : (x⊗y) ⊗z= x⊗(y⊗z)neutral element
3. Neutral element: ∃e∈G∀ x∈G : x⊗e= xand e⊗x= xinverse element
4. Inverse element: ∀x ∈G∃ y ∈G : x⊗y = eand y⊗x = e. We often
write x−1 to denote the inverse element of x.
Remark. The inverse element is deﬁned with respect to the operation ⊗
and does not necessarily mean 1
x. ♦
If additionally ∀x,y ∈G : x⊗y = y⊗x, then G = (G,⊗) is an AbelianAbelian group
group (commutative).
Example 2.10 (Groups)
